name: USB audio (from host)
description: This algorithm exposes the USB audio from the host, if one is connected. The host sees 8 output channels. Each one of these can be output to any of the disting NT’s busses. Note that the signals from the USB host don’t just have to emerge directly from the module’s outputs; they could just as well be the inputs to other algorithms, allowing you to process audio from the host through the disting. Note also that 'USB audio' doesn’t mean that the signals have to be audio; they could also be CVs, if you’d like to exchange signals with, say, VCV Rack or similar.
use_cases: Receiving USB audio from a host
Routing USB channels to internal busses for further processing
Exchanging CV signals with external modular environments like VCV Rack
Audio signal routing and distribution within disting NT

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: The bus on which to output USB channel 1.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: The standard Add/Replace mode selector for channel 1, as described above.

parameters.description: The bus on which to output USB channel 2.
